english_translation: He is called Abu Abdullah. He is the owner of the Nahr Mu'aqqal (canal). Umar ibn al-Khattab commanded him to dig it so he dug it. He had transferred to Basra, settled in it, and built a house there. He died in Basra during the final years of the caliphate of Mu'awiyah ibn Abi Sufyan, during the governorship of Ubaydullah ibn Ziyad.

english_translation: His name was Nafi' ibn Masruq, and in some hadiths his name is mentioned as Masruh. His mother was Sumayyah. He was the brother of Ziyad ibn Abi Sufyan through his mother. He was a slave in at-Ta'if. When the Prophet ﷺ besieged the people of at-Ta'if, he said: "Whoever comes down to us from the free will be safe, and whoever comes down to us from the slaves will be free." Several slaves of the people of at-Ta'if came down to him, among them Abu Bakrah. The Prophet ﷺ freed them. Abu Bakrah came down to them using a rope (bakrah), so they nicknamed him Abu Bakrah. He used to say: I am the freed one of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ.

chainIssues: This entry contains narrative historical information without a chain of transmission
No isnad structure is present
Content is biographical in nature

potential_issues.issue: Entry is biographical narrative without hadith transmission chain
potential_issues.impact: While it provides important historical context about Abu Bakrah, it is not a hadith proper and cannot be evaluated using hadith authentication methodology.

potential_issues.issue: The account references the Prophet ﷺ but no transmission chain documents the narration
potential_issues.impact: Although it describes an event involving the Prophet ﷺ, the lack of isnad prevents authentication.

Explanation of the kunya Abu Bakrah from his descent by rope

english_translation: Narrated by a man from Thaqif: We asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ to return Abu Bakrah to us, as he was our slave, and he was besieging Thaqif. He refused to return him to us and said: "He is freed by Allah, and freed by His Messenger."

Topics: Incident of Thaqif requesting return of Abu Bakrah
Prophet's ﷺ refusal and declaration of freedom

english_translation: Narrated by Amir: Thaqif asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ to return Abu Bakrah as a slave. He said: "No, he is freed by Allah, and freed by His Messenger." And it was said that Abu Bakrah had testified against al-Mughirah ibn Shu'bah with that testimony and was beaten with the prescribed punishment. He bore this against his brother Ziyad in his heart. When Mu'awiyah claimed Ziyad, Abu Bakrah forbade him from this, but Ziyad refused and agreed with Mu'awiyah. Abu Bakrah swore he would never speak to him again, and he died before speaking to him. Ziyad had honored the children of Abu Bakrah and elevated them, and gave them land grants and positions of authority, so they came to great wealth, and they claimed to be from the Arabs and from the descendants of Nafi' ibn al-Harith al-Thaqafi. Abu Bakrah died during the caliphate of Mu'awiyah ibn Abi Sufyan in Basra, during the governorship of Ziyad.

potential_issues.impact: Mursal hadiths require stronger corroborating chains or documentation of the missing link to be fully acceptable.

english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: I entered upon al-Bara ibn Malik while he was singing and vibrating (using) his bow. I said: How long will this continue? He said: "O Anas, do you think I will die in bed? By Allah, I have killed ninety (enemies) besides those in which I shared the killing." - meaning polytheists.

english_translation: And it was narrated: When the day of al-Aqabah came in Persia, and the people had scattered, al-Bara ibn Malik arose and rode his horse which was in a state of heat, then said to his companions: "How evil is what you called upon your peers against you!" He charged at the enemy, and Allah granted victory to the Muslims through him, and he was martyred that day. May Allah have mercy on him.

english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: I served the Messenger of Allah ﷺ for ten years. He never commanded me to do something that I procrastinated on, nor did he blame me for something I did. And when anyone of his family blamed me, he would say: "Leave him alone, for if it had been determined or decreed to be, it would have been."

english_translation: When death approached Anas ibn Malik, he instructed that Muhammad ibn Sirine wash him and pray over him. Muhammad was imprisoned, but they went to the governor, who was a man from Banu Umayyah, and he permitted him. He went and washed him, shrouded him, and prayed over him in Anas's house in al-Taff, then returned and entered the prison as he was. [Multiple chains about Anas's service to the Prophet ﷺ and the Prophet's forbearance toward him]

english_translation: Narrated by Sinan ibn Rabi'ah: I heard Anas ibn Malik saying: My mother took me to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said: "O Messenger of Allah, your servant boy, supplicate to Allah for him." He said: "O Allah, increase his wealth and children, lengthen his life, and forgive his sin." Anas said: I have buried from my own line nearly one hundred except for two, or one hundred and two. And my fruit-bearing tree bears twice in a year. And I have lived until I am weary of life, and I hope for the fourth.

potential_issues.issue: Two Saduq narrators in succession, with 'an transmission from Abd al-Aziz ibn Abi Jamil
potential_issues.impact: While acceptable, the presence of multiple Saduq narrators and indirect transmission introduces slight concern about precision.

Topics: Anas ibn Malik's awareness of the Prophet's ﷺ supplication for him

english_translation: Narrated by Thumamah ibn Abdullah ibn Anas: The vineyard of Anas ibn Malik would bear fruit twice every year.

narrators.name: Thumamah ibn Abdullah ibn Anas
narrators.full_name: Thumamah ibn Abdullah ibn Anas al-Ansari

chainIssues: Multiple Saduq narrators in the chain (father and Thumamah ibn Abdullah)

potential_issues.issue: Multiple Saduq narrators with 'an transmission from the son of Anas
potential_issues.impact: Acceptable chain but with combined weakness from multiple Saduq narrators.

Topics: Miraculous bearing of Anas ibn Malik's vineyard twice yearly
Fulfillment of the Prophet's ﷺ supplication

english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: The Prophet ﷺ said to him: "O my son."

narrators.name: Anas ibn Malik
narrators.full_name: Anas ibn Malik ibn al-Nadhr al-Ansari

chainIssues: al-Ja'd Abu Uthman is Saduq with 'an transmission
Otherwise chain has strong reliable narrators (two Affan and Hisham are Thiqah Thabt)

potential_issues.issue: al-Ja'd Abu Uthman is Saduq grade with 'an transmission
potential_issues.impact: While the surrounding chain is strong, this one Saduq narrator with indirect transmission slightly affects reliability, but overall chain remains acceptable.

Topics: Prophet's ﷺ affectionate address to Anas ibn Malik
